args:
Caught in a desperate situation, the prince
offers Chelle a deal that leads to her forces
pulling back. At the same time, Leonidas moves
on the Halidom in an effort to destroy it utterly.
Hearing this, the party heads off at full speed
in order to protect their home.
Well, this ain't good. We're surrounded.
You put up more of a fight than I \nanticipated! Sadly for you, it's only\na matter of time before I prevail.
Chelle! You can't be all right with this!
What exactly are you trying to say?
You want me to fight Morsayati. Don't you?
Oh, dear. He's found us out.
If that's true, what possible use is it for\nus to exhaust ourselves fighting here?
I'm not telling you to cooperate with us,\nbut it shouldn't be necessary for you to\nside with the Other, either.
Oh no. It is quite necessary.
I side with Morsayati because\nit is proper and just.
However you may think about it,\nour PEOPLE believe that Zethia is\nthe legitimate heir to the throne.

And the people standing in opposition to
this rightful heirâthe ones who have
thrown the kingdom into chaosâare you
and your ragtag companions.
Only the most cynical of people would\npossibly place the appearance of\npropriety above the actual thing!
And yet, appearances are critical!\nAfter all, what catches the eye of\nthe populace if not appearances?
The people rest easy and obey their ruler\nbecause of the appearance of legitimacy.\nThe entire system is based on belief.
How can you call yourself a ruler when\nyou would steal this peace away from\nyour own people?
THAT'S why you're falling\nin line with Morsayati?!
Indeed. And if by some chance I am to\nbecome monarch, I will do it properly and\nhave Zethia cede the throne to me.
In that case, I have a proposal.
Oh, THIS should be a delight! What do\nyou have that could possibly interest moi?
I'll defeat Morsayati. And as you say,\nthat will likely make it look like I'm\nstealing the throne from Zethia.
So after I do it...you can kill me.
You'd kill the usurper of the throne,\nand in so doing would bring about the\ncreation of a rightful monarch.
This is a serious proposal?\nNo reneging? No tricks?

No tricks. I'll save Zethia and free the
kingdom from the Other's control.
Once that happens, I don't particularly
care who takes the throne.

If that offer came from anyone else,
I'd think it a clever ruse of some sort.
But this one is so purrfectly honest!
What will you do, Chelle?
That being said, I have decided to seize\ncontrol of Rovetelle in order to ensure the\nultimate safety of my forces.
Once I do, I imagine I'll find small pockets\nof rebellion to keep me busy for a while.
In fact, I'll probably be there juuuust long\nenough for you and Leonidas to work out\nyour differences one way or the other.
Come, Cat SÃ¬th! We'll be in ever so much\ndanger if we can't force a quick surrender\nout of Rovetelle.
You couldn't be more obvious if you tried.
This means all we have to deal with now\nis Leonidas's army! Let's go!
We have trouble, Your Highness.\nLeonidas's army approaches the Halidom.
He's heading for the Halidom\ninstead of fighting us?!
The castle has only the most minimal of\ndefenses at present; they won't stand a\nchance if he lays siege now!
What is it, Alex? You look pale.
A-apologies. I was just thinking anew\nabout His Highnessâer, Leonidas.
Ah, right. You used to serve under him.

Yesâso I know there is a cold, harsh side
of the man. A part unconcerned with the
human cost of his actions, and one who
would do anything to achieve his aims.
However, he is also prideful in the\nextreme. He believes in might entirely,\nand prides himself as a conqueror.
Whether temporarily or not, I don't believe\nfor one second that he would bend the\nknee to the Other or anyone else.

Leonidas said that standing supreme
astride the world meant one had to
have the greatest power in that world.
He said that was what he wanted.

And I don't think that's untrue. But I also
can't help but feel like there's something
franticâsomething hurriedâabout his
current behavior.
It's hard to explain. However, I feel this\nmust be the reason he's falling in line\nwith the Other.
If we could just find that reason, perhaps\nwe could... Er, I mean... *sigh* Apologies,\nYour Highness. I am not being very clear.
Maybe you just want to help him.
Help?! No! Why would I ever...
It's not untrue that, for a time, Leonidas\nwas my source of stability.

In the end, I was just another pawn for
him to sacrifice in service to his strategy.
Be that as it may, I don't know what would
have become of me without him.
I owe him a debt. That's as clearly\nas I can put it right now.

...Forgive me, Your Highness. These are
not words that should be bandied about
regarding the enemy we seek to fight.
Pray forget I mentioned it.
It's okay, AlexâI've been having\nsimilar thoughts myself.
I'm not convinced of my brother's methods,\nwhich is why we're about to cross swords.
But that doesn't mean everything\nyou just said isn't also true.
Leonidas is a man of actionâa man with\nthe ironclad will to do the impossible.\nAnd I...I respect him.
So if my brother has even the slightest\nhesitation about his current path,\nI want to free him from it.
That being said, I realize now is a pretty\npoor time to be considering such things.
But I still can't give up my hope,\nso I don't think you need to, either.
Come on, Alex. Let's end this.
Let's face my brother with the power\nof our combined hope!
